intro: Desmochaeta atropurpurea, commonly known as the purplestem false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, often displaying a pink or purple hue. Its leaves are usually glandular and may exude a mild, sticky substance when touched. Desmochaeta atropurpurea thrives in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wetlands.
